instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.0A No PPBUS
threads.message:
Hello everyone

Board came by liquid damaged and messed up by previous service. Some components are missing, dirty, <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> overheated etc. No voltage on USB-C meter at all

What is done for now:
Replaced all 4 <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>
Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
Soldered back missing <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7960</CHIP>
Soldered back missing <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>

Now got back 20 volts, but 0 amps
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 20 volts, stable
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.6-0.9 volts. No short
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> is ok, 0 ohm, 20 volts
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7061</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7062</RESISTOR> is 1 Ohm as it should be
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and 7040 as i said is already changed

Is it something else can pull the line to the groung, or <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> still doesn't work properly by some reason?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.0A No PPBUS
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.
Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C7030</CAPACITOR>/40 all good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.0A No PPBUS
threads.message:
Diod mode for PPBUS - 0.42

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> - 20.0 v
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> 6.6 v ( is it a normal value?)
Vdda/p - 5.0 v
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> - 3.4 v
Amon - 0 (diode mode 0.64)
Bmon -  0 (diode mode 0.64)

All elements around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> are good. No short/values equals the schematic

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.0A No PPBUS
threads.message:
You should change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

Do not expect miracles from this board, of liquid damaged and already messed up by someone else.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.0A No PPBUS
threads.message:
Yes, you right about miracles. But i just want to understand why ppbus is missing. Just collecting knolege and expirience piece by piese to my head :)

Changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> one more time, AMON and BMON is still 0 volts. Other values also didn't changed
Is there something else i can pay attention to, or this board is just a waisting of time?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.0A No PPBUS
threads.message:
Very likely wasting time.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> expect SMC communication, to generate <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Some blocks of SMC work, as you get 20V on charger.
This do not assure SMC is in perfect working condition.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.0A No PPBUS
threads.message: Ok, thanks anyway for an answer:giggle:
